newsitem.title: USA: Heinz has higher quarter, sees strong year.
newsitem.headline: Heinz has higher quarter, sees strong year.

text.p: H.J. Heinz Co., the giant prepared foods company, Tuesday reported higher second-quarter earnings and said it is on track for double-digit earnings growth this year.

The Pittsburgh-based maker of such products as Heinz Ketchup and baked beans had second-quarter earnings of $177.5 million, or 47 cents per share, on revenues of $2.39 billion. A year earlier it earned $158.1 million, or 42 cents per share, on revenues of $2.29 billion.

During the quarter, the company completed the acquisition of the pet food businesses of Martin Feed Mills Limited of Elmira, Ontario. Martin produces and markets cat and dog food throughout Canada and also exports to the Far East and Europe.

"Our six-point plan for growth around the world is working and we are on track for double-digit earnings growth this year," Chairman and Chief Executive Anthony J.F. O'Reilly said in a statement accompanying the results.
Heinz stock was down $1.125 at $35.875 on the New York Stock Exchange in morning trading.
